author: wolfgang512
post_text: April 27, 2017 at 10:34â€¯PM#1Hello folks,After extensive trial and error, and also a while trawling through this forum trying to find the answer to my question - I am here in need of help.Situation: I am using an imported video file in the image pool to bitmap over a group of lights - that bit is working perfectly.I have compressed the video to the smallest size that I can and is sitting at 7MB. Having this video in the show file has considerably lengthened the load time of my session/save across my network (2x Full Size, 1x NPU).I'm looking for a way to, via the command line (macro) to import the video file to the image pool for the particular song I need it for, and then delete it after so it doesn't have to live in my show file. Obviously I'm fine with the syntax of deleting the pool image, but I don't know the way to load it to the pool from the CMD line.I have the video file in the 'importexport' folder on my USB keyI have been trying: SD 4 import "filename" image 69 - but that hasn't worked. Please could someone shine a light and show me where I'm going wrong.Many thanks!! Jamie
title: Import Video Bitmap CMD
